options.text: Yes, you can fly to EUAD at any time after 0630 UTC, even though the airfield is open at 0620.

Yes, but prior permission is required between 0620-2 115.
Yes, but you must file a flight plan before departing, at least two hours before the scheduled arrival time.

variant.question: In order to follow his planned course, a pilot flies a heading of 260°, which was calculated for the forecast wind of 190°/40kt. The actual wind encountered at his altitude is 210°/40kt. What will be his track?

options.text: He will be left of the planned course.
This cannot be answered with the provided data.
He will be on the planned course.
He will be right of the planned course.

variant.question: A flight has been planned based on a forecast true wind of 120º/40 kt. The actual wind experienced in-flight was 240º/40 kt. Assuming a true track of 090º, what will happen?

options.text: The new track will be right of the original track.
The new compass indication will decrease.
The new track will be left of the original track.
